title: Defintion.
text: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires, “the State” includes the Government and Parliament of India and the Government and the Legislature of each of the States and all local or other authorities within the territory of India or under the control of the Government of India
summary:
Art 12 expressly defines the term 'State'. It inclds GoI, Parl, GoS, SL, 'all local authorities' or 'other authorities' in terr. of India or u. control of GoI.
    The last part implies that even Private bodies in terr. of India can be considered as 'State' u. Art 12 if they work as an instrument of State.
RD Shetty vs Intl Airport Authority of India, 1979: Justice PN Bhagwati gave the instrumentality test to determine 'pervasive' Govt control.

Rupa Ashoka Hurra Case, 2002: SC held that SC itself does not fall within ambit of State u. Art 12; no judicial proceedings could be made against it.

2024: SC held that Air India ceased to be a State or its instrumentality post disinvestment.

NCRWC: recommended that an Explanation be added to Art 12 to clarify that the term 'other authorities' inclds any person/body performing fncs of a public nature.
